definition: to puff up/to swell up/to inflate/to blow air into sth/(fig.) to encourage/to support
drum/CL:通[tong4],面[mian4]/to drum/to strike/to rouse/to bulge/to swell
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: I spent a week gathering the courage to say no.
sentences.chinese: 我花了一個星期才鼓氣起勇氣說不。

sentences.english: A man who has won mg laurels can only encourage the brave .
sentences.chinese: 象我這樣贏得了桂冠的人，能給勇敢的人們鼓氣。

sentences.english: May also pinch first abandons the air-blowing, then shuts up does swallows the bright movement.
sentences.chinese: 也可先捏棄鼓氣，然後閉嘴做吞明動作。

sentences.english: You cheer for the same losing football team.
sentences.chinese: 你們爲同一支落了下風的橄欖球隊加油鼓氣。

definition: to claw wildly/to scratch frantically/to arrest people indiscriminately
all crows are black (idiom)/evil people are bad all over the world

definition: to go around in circles/to make a detour/(fig.) to beat about the bush
